alert.note: Alert for Clay; Laurel; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Laurel, Owsley, southwestern Estill, northeastern Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle, southwestern Lee and northwestern Clay Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bandy to near Valley Oak to Grade. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bloss, Pongo and Hansford around 455 PM EDT. Spiro, Maretburg, Luner, Sand Hill, Billows, Bromo, Wabp, Ottowa, Bunch and Sand Springs around 500 PM EDT. Mount Vernon, Muellersville, Bernstadt, Renfro Valley, Lake Linville, Lamero, Hummel, Camp Wildcat, Gauley and Mershons around 505 PM EDT. London, East Bernstadt, Parrot, Eberle, Bummer, Johnetta, Carico, Middlefork, Carmichael and Ardery around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Eglon, Dabolt, Mcwhorter, Olin, Greenmount, Atlanta, Deese, Annville, Bond, Cornelius, McKee, Waneta, Datha, Royrader, Privett, Herd, Mummie, Zekes Point, Gray Hawk, High Knob, Green Hall, Malcomb, Lakes, Wind Cave, Shepherdtown, Sturgeon, Elian, Foxtown, Chestnutburg, Sacker Gap, Booneville, Scoville, Thomas, Endee, Old Orchard, Arvel, Sextons Creek, Turin, Major and Levi. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
